entry.def: To perforate something means to make a hole or holes in it.

example.ex: I refused to wear headphones because they can perforate your eardrums.
example.tran: 我不愿戴耳机，因为它可能会使鼓膜穿孔。

means.word_mean: 2. having a number or series of holes;

auth_sentence.content: Many theories have been suggested for the unusual perforated leaves.

auth_sentence.content: Her doctors suspected a perforated bowel and recommended immediate surgery.
